Posted By: MyrBattlecube (8/12/2011 10:46:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
OK, first on the art.... It's actually good. Yes it looks creepy and not as glorious as the other vampires, but that's the point.... He's a vampire that steals your creatures or child.... He suppose to look disturbed.  
  
Now onto his second ability... You guys do realize it does not require him to tap to activate, right? And he can tap himself on the turn he's cast! And you can activate this as a response? In a weenie vampire deck, this is killer, even in Standard 2011, unless you're against RDW, you should have no problem pumping out 4 to 5 vampires by t4 before him, then you can start capturing on turn four. You should also include 4 [Bloodghast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodghast) for increased consistence for creature recursion, and also 8 sac. lands like [Marsh Flats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marsh Flats) and [Verdant Catacombs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Verdant Catacombs).  
  
t1: 1 drop  
t2: 2 1 drops  
t3: Pump more weenies for numbers, or Gatekeeper, or Nighthawk  
t4: Pump another 1 drop if you can for redundancy, then cast Captivating Vampire, t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
OK, first on the art.... It's actually good. Yes it looks creepy and not as glorious as the other vampires, but that's the point.... He's a vampire that steals your creatures or child.... He suppose to look disturbed.

Now onto his second ability... You guys do realize it does not require him to tap to activate, right? And he can tap himself on the turn he's cast! And you can activate this as a response? In a weenie vampire deck, this is killer, even in Standard 2011, unless you're against RDW, you should have no problem pumping out 4 to 5 vampires by t4 before him, then you can start capturing on turn four. You should also include 4 Bloodghast for increased consistence for creature recursion, and also 8 sac. lands like Marsh Flats and Verdant Catacombs.

Posted By: BLKND (9/2/2011 11:07:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Absolutely terrible art. When you think "Captivating Vampire", the first thing that comes to mind is a beautiful vampire lady, a seductress. On the more masculine side of things, you think of a vampire along the lines of Sorin Markov, charming and aristocratic. The art on this card is neither of those things - it looks Severus fuckdamn Snape crossed with an emo kid who hasn't washed his hair in months.  
  
Just awful. I wouldn't play this outside of a draft/sealed where for some reason I ended up with this guy and a bunch of vamps and nothing else useful.
posts.html:
